messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Good fake out of Japan
messages.msgSnippet: Given how rough the finish work is, it looks like it was probably cut by some automated process since the layout of the design is pretty accurate.  Talking to
messages.messageBody:
Given how rough the finish work is, it looks like it was probably cut by some automated process since the layout of the design is pretty accurate. Talking to a few people doing this kind of work, apparently a high pressure water jet cutter is the tool of choice.

Jim



This arrived today, it can't be more than 1 year old, looks great on my
training blade.

Shocking up close, rough as guts, file marks everywhere,

Oh well, you win some, you loose some. Such is the game we play.

Rich

/http://www.nihontomessageboard.com/tsuba_collection/higo_pine.jpg
/




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
